caption: I went with my family to celebrate a birthday last night and I was so impressed by the service, the food, the atmosphere, everything. The staff were all so personable and friendly The food was delicious First time here , but not the last Thank You Dante and Antonio

I really had great hopes for my dinner reading all the great reviews, the menu looks like top notch north-end restaurants. We sat at the bar The server was really nice and helpful. The atmosphere was wonderfully inviting and the bar stools were very comfortable and plush.  THE FOOD : The tuna poke was more of cucumber and avocado poke with a sprinkle of Tuna ! The taste was good but the tuna portion needs to be more of 50/50 rather than 30/70 increase the price too  The  pasta was soggy, watery  and lukewarm. Again 30/70 ratio of CANNED mushrooms to pasta.  I did had an upset stomach all night long.  Im very disappointed, i will go again if they only have a big improvement in food preparation. Too bad !

My wife and I were in the mood for some authentic Italian last night, and this gem of a restaurant turned out to be quite a pleasant surprise. We haven't had chance to explore much during the pandemic, and in the before times, I'm sure we'd be visiting this place at least several times a month. The carpaccio was flavored perfectly, the octopus grilled to an excellent texture, and I've never seen truffle pieces so abundant in a mushroom risotto. We will be back for sure for more well-packaged takeout in the future, and look forward to a sit-down meal once this is all over.
Beautiful open concept establishment, fantastic service and the food was to die for, better than the north end!

This place is a clear ‘do not miss’. Authentic, homemade Italian on Moody Street with a cozy and romantic yet trendy vibe. Meatballs are unparalleled! Arguably the best espresso martinis in Boston.  Dante, the owner, is from Abruzzo and takes his Italian wine and food seriously - nothing misses a beat.  Gorgeous decor, impressive menu and a stellar staff. Very impressed.

We were very excited to try Dante's new restaurant Vinotta last night, as we frequented he restaurant in Newton. The ambiance is both beautiful, warm and modern industrial. Our friends Chris and Mylang have been long time customers of Dante, and we ALL loved the food and staff at Vinotta. With 4 adults and a foodie 5 year old we had an big variety of choice at the table. Appetizers were Beef Carpaccio, Buffalo Mozzarella, Grilled Octopus and Insulata Romana. All extremely fresh, bursting with flavor and beautifully presented. Main Entrees were Ragu, Veal Piccata, Risotto de Mare, Linguinin with Clams, and Chicken Peperonata - once again phenomenal in presentation and flavors! And don't forget dessert...you must try these! We had drinks, we had wine - you can't go wrong.  If you are looking for a date night, somewhere to gather with good friends, or family meal, Vinotta is an excellent choice! Great food is one thing, excellent friendly staff is another! Dante and team you have hit it out of the park with your restaurant! We all can't wait to come back! See you soon :)

My family and I enjoyed a delicious dinner in a very upbeat and comfortable setting. Service was excellent (thanks Chris), and the reasonably priced Abruzzi wine paired perfectly with our meals. The eggplant appetizer was delicious as was my Veal Chop (special), my wife and son both had pasta dishes which were homemade and delectable. Dante stopped by to introduce himself, he is very charming and welcoming- we will be back! Thank you.

Best kept secret on Moody Street! Signature cocktails, delicious food, wonderful ambience, comfortable seating, and friendly and accommodating staff. Dante, the owner knows what he’s doing! Everything about this new restaurant on Moody Street is excellent. We managed to get their last table without a reservation but it won’t be long before it’s packed with regulars. Reasonable prices for dishes with good quality meats, fresh seafood, pasta, and gourmet appetizers. I had a fig martini and pasta with mushrooms and shaved black truffles. Outstanding. Don’t forget to try a cannoli for dessert. Can’t wait to go back!
Outstanding cuisine, service and atmosphere. The menu's diversity requires several visits to fully appreciate. Work prevented tasting the wine, which probably would have earned it the 5th star.
Amazing place! Amazing food! Amazing people who work there! Highly recommend!

This restaurant was an incredible experience. Everything that we ate would of been the star of the meal anywhere else! The waitstaff was friendly and helpful and the drinks were well made but still strong. We can’t wait to come back!!
Went for dinner and ordered appetizers, entrees, and cocktails. Every single plate put on the table was delicious. Cannot recommend Vinotta enough!
What a great surprise. We were looking for an Italian restaurant. The food was fresh warm and delicious. The bread is great . We will definitely go back
My favorite new restaurant on Moody. Interesting Italian dishes, beautifully prepared. Not same old same old items. Everything is house made. So glad they opened!

When Red Bird disappeared from Moody St. (sadly) I wondered what was next for this storied restaurant space (former home to Tuacan Grill). Well, patience paid off in dividends. Dante Bellucci's newest restaurant, Venotta did its soft opening the weekend before Thanksgiving. I ordered takeout (their menu & site are still not on-line).  We got the Shrimp Tagliatelle (with garlic white wine, tomato basil white shrimp) and the Lemon Chicken (with artichokes, mushrooms sundried tomatoes and capers).  Both dishes were incredibly fresh, delicious with flavorful; the food quality was outstanding. Since I didn't dine-in I cannot review their service or kitchen (although my order was ready when promised).
Wishing Dante all the best. With his personality, knowledge and experience “Restaurant Vinotta” is going to be the place for your culinary outing.
Exceptional place to get some food when in a rush. Their service is quick, prices are reasonable, good ambience. Will come back again
